TopicTitle: Bug - Solar panels generate power while the sun is blocked by Minmus

Articles.Content:
Even though the sun is blocked by Minmus, the solar panels still generate power.

The only mods I have running are Mechjeb and TAC life support, but I am posting this in unmodded because I think I have also seen this in an unmodded game.

I would add a screenshot, but it seems it is only possible to insert an image from an URL.
Also happened to me, but I have too many mods so i don't know.
Can you right click the solar panel and provide a screenshot of the information?

No, because I'm not allowed to.

I'll try to describe it to you though:

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-16T21:35:55Z" title="05/16/2015 09:35  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 16, 2015</time> by surge**

Sort of a bug, mostly a limitation of the engine, planets don't actually block the "light" at all, to get around this when KSP thinks you're not able to see the sun it turns the light *off*.

This is not reliable when at dawn or dusk, or when a mountain blocks the sun, it should stop a little after nightfall though.

I can provide a screenshot of the bug.

On Kerbin all is working as expected. On Minmus the panels produce full energy even at midnight. I didnt try on other celestial bodies so far.

The panels turn in the direction of the sun (to the bottom) and light is even blocked by a tank below the solar panel that is used as the base structure.
